lang.create: Give at least one tag for the collection if you want more use , to seperate them
lang.name: Name
lang.add-dir: Do you want to give shared tags to the images(y/n)?

commands.addTags: id tags add tags for the item
commands.removeTags: id tags remove tags from the item
commands.rm: id remove the image(s) from collection
commands.o: open the image in an external application
commands.info: id show all stored info about the image(s)
commands.ro: * reorder the viewed list. * can be tags, asc or desc
commands.filter: t Removes images with the tag t from the list
commands.find: t Removes images without the tag t from the list

help.help-coll: n next page p previous page q quit s id Select the collection(s) ls List currently selected collections cls Clear selection g id show thumbnails of the images in a collection slide id start a slideshow of a collection at id add tags to collection(s) rt id remove tags from collection(s) r id rename the collection(s) info id show all stored info about the image(s) jump x jump to page x. First page is 0 ro * reorder the viewed list. * can be tags, asc or desc help display this text The commands that can affect multiple images accept the word all to mean all images on the page. id on any commad can be raplaced by s to use selected collections.

lang.edit-guide: What do you wish to do? at add tags for the collection rt remove tags from the collection r rename the collection ef edit files in the collection q stop editing
lang.edit-rt-q: Which tags do you wish to remove?(use , to separate)
lang.edit-rm: Are you sure you want to remove the listed files?
lang.add-q: Do you want to give tags to the images now?(y/n)
lang.edit-check-thumb: Do you wish to view the file thumbnails before editing(y/n)?
lang.edit-check-correct: Were the images correct(y/n)?(you can remove files but not add)
lang.edit-check-remove: Which file(s) you want to remove(use , and id given)
lang.setup-assistant: Which setting do you need help with?(only maxlen is available)
lang.setup-maxlen: Write something until one terminal row is full you might need to press return twise before you get an answer
lang.setup-askhelp: Do you need help with the settings(y/n)
lang.setup-set: Give a setting and a value seperated with space(e.g. lang en). To set multilevel settings use the format upper:lower value e.g. window:width 1024. q quits the application.
lang.is-dir: %s is a directory. Do you wish to add its contents?(y/n)
lang.not-exist: File or directory %s cannot be found
lang.wrong-search: %s is not an accepted search type. Use inc or exc insetad.
lang.add-selected: Do you want to add the selected files to a collection?
